website_summaries.verdict: One of the most popular scientific calculators by one of the top brands in the industry. It's also reasonably priced and can tackle numerous math functions, but not all.
pros: Offers both solar and battery power capabilities and a 4-line display
We love the edit, cut, and paste functions
Suitable for basic algebra to geometry and more
cons: Reported inaccuracies when using scientific notation
Screen is difficult to see in some low-light settings

customer_reviews.title: Buy this over the TI-30XSII
customer_reviews.text: These are THE BEST calculator to buy for a medium level (middle school through algebra) math student. I teach secondary and post secondary students and this is the calculator I tell them all to buy. It is better than the TI-30XSII because you can see what you had previously input. That is really the main difference between the two calculators and this one allows you to see what you put in before. It's superior in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Stuart

customer_reviews.title: I love this calculator!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing this calculator, only because I can’t find my old TI-30XS. The last one I had lasted my brother and I at least 7-8 years until I lost it recently! I’ve seen a few reviews saying that this calculator is awful for math or chemistry and that it doesn’t solve things properly, but that is NOT TRUE AT ALL. I’ve used this from middle school math all the way to calculus and now college chemistry, and it works great! You just have to be aware of how you put things into the calculator, meaning parentheses are your friends!!! And you get a lot of awareness from that, this calculator is great for students!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great for Test taking!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good calculator. It meets requirements for almost any standardized test (including but limited to GED, ACT, SAT and others). The functions are all pretty easy once you know how to use them. I used this calculator on my GED and my ACT and it worked great and had no problems. The display is kind of dark so it can be hard to read at times. Great for test taking and highly recommend it for any test takers out there in desperate need of a good calculator. Not a good calculator for basic, everyday use though. If you are looking for a good, basic scientific calculator try other TX-Instrument calculators that are higher models.
customer_reviews.author: Codyk

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and better than most calculators I've used so far.
customer_reviews.text: My last TI has mysteriously grown legs and ran away. So, I purchased this one and have been pleasantly impressed with it. Great for math students and comes with cover that can be used to sit the calculator in it or to cover the screen and buttons on the front. I like that feature because it makes putting it in a case less prone to scratches and keeps it protected. This was suggested to all students by our professor so it will be easier to follow his examples now too. Good price, fast shipping, and quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Display Does Not Look Right
customer_reviews.text: Already had this same model calculator for a class but bought this 2nd one for an upcoming exam so I had a backup. Comparing the two, there is something not right with the screen on the new one when it came out of the package (there is a shadow of all the pixels staying lit constantly). I know it is an inexpensive product so I guess some defective ones may slip through but it is disappointing. Will probably go to local store to buy another and just test it in the parking lot so if it is defective I can return it on the spot.
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY if you need scientific notation functionality!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other scientific calculators, using the scientific notation (x10^n) key requires the extra step of adding parentheses before and after. Very inconvenient. As a teacher using these has increased the number of errors my students make, simply because this calculator requires an extra step that is NOT the standard. To Texas Instruments: Terrible oversight that needs a fix.
customer_reviews.author: britton427amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good at beginning but comfortability wanes with few days of usage badly
customer_reviews.text: The device was really smooth in the beginning. The buttons over time has gone brittle with 20 days of usage. I think I got too carried away with the initial performance with the smoothness. I sense this few keys hardening and making comfortability of use as disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Anand Panduranga

customer_reviews.title: Caution!!! Root function malfunction!!
customer_reviews.text: Root calculations work sporadically, resulting in a failing grade on a final. I can figure out the root of 144 like this calculator, but when it comes to any number higher buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful!! Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Just like the one my daughter uses in math class..just a different color! Great investment and I no longer have to download scientific calculator apps or use goggle. Great instructions although she didn’t need them because her teacher taught them how to use it. This calculator makes it much easier to double check math problems that she has worked out on paper to make sure she got it correct..No ordinary calculator will do!! I may use it for college AFTER she shows ME how to use it.. I have no problem learning from a 13 year old.. or any age for that matter!!! 😁
customer_reviews.author: ArmyGurl

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - CANNOT RETURN THIS ITEM
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM'S SCREEN WAS NOT WHAT WE NEEDED AND ATTEMPTED TO RETURN THIS ITEM BUT APPARENTLY ITS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN. THIS IS THE FIRST TIME I HAVE EVER HAD AN ISSUE RETURNING AN ITEM ON AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Dotz

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I’m an engineering student. I bought this calculator after I failed my first physics test because I couldn’t calculate stuff fast enough on my four function calculator. This calculator helped me. I needed a calculator that wasn’t super expensive & that saved previous calculations so you can go up & grab values to reuse them in more calculations. This does the job really well. All I use it for is calculations, it is the perfect calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Math is Hard. This makes it easier
customer_reviews.text: Needed for university. The calculations work very well, but it did not help me enjoy algebra any better. Even after 2 semesters of algebra. I also used it for Statistics, and I liked it better for that. Probably because it was a better subject matter. All kidding aside, this calculator performed all the necessary functions of college level Algebra 1 and 2 as well as Statisticsn and Med Dosing Calculations. Performed alongside models that were well over $100 and did everything I needed it to do. Pleased with this purchase. Even more pleased I got an A in Statistics
customer_reviews.author: jen small

customer_reviews.title: Need scientific notation?  Learn this calculator.
customer_reviews.text: Need a calculator with EASY SCIENTIFIC NOTATION capability? The TI-30XS is the gold standard for scientific calculators for students for pros alike. The reason this is superior is because, unlike other sci calculators, you enter your math problem pretty much as it is written or the way to need it written. Also, the big screen gives you four lines of math, not just one or two. Many online video tutorials by students and teachers make learning to use the TI-30XS easier than reading the user guide. It's durable, too. You can drop it all day and it keeps working. Remembers your last answer, unless you clear it out. Switch to engineering calculator with a simple setting change.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I guess I am lazy, because I base some of my opinions for software and computing, on how much of the manual you need to study before you can use it. This calculator just worked, out of the box, as expected. Read a few pages and you can do even more impressive calculations. I bought this for a standardized TEST, that allowed calculators, but NOT, programmable calculators. As near as I can tell, this is the MOST calculator you can buy that is not programmable, at least for less than $20.00. It has ambient light solar power (battery saver). Not small, about 1" longer than my full size cellular phone. Comes with a front side cover.
customer_reviews.author: Sabayon Linux User

customer_reviews.title: Not completely accurate
customer_reviews.text: Doing basic probability problems with decimals/fractions results in inaccurate rounding of numbers. Tested on two other calculators of different brands including the built-in apple calculator. The screen is also quite hard to read and many calculations must be done while holding the calculator vertically with two hands vs. flat on a surface.
customer_reviews.author: Pickle

customer_reviews.title: STILL WORKING AFTER AT LEAST 8 YEARS
customer_reviews.text: Hands down favorite calculator I have ever owned. I’ve had this same model since I was in 6th grade. I still actually have the same calculator I had when I was in 6th grade and I am now a sophomore in college. These things never break! I actually have been buying them as birthday presents for my girlfriend, her dad and some of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.

customer_reviews.title: Good math calculator for 7th grader
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girl that's starting 7th grade. This scientific calculator has lots of function and it's perfect for students learning math. The buttons feel good and it's easy to press. The display is large and clear with multiple lines. The back cover can be flipped to use as a front cover to protect the calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Mel W

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 year old daughter to use for home school. She won't be needing all the functions yet but I figured it was something she could grow with. It is extremely lightweight and fits comfortably in my son's hand. I really like that it's solar. We go through so many batteries in a month so having a device that doesn't require batteries is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: SYR

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic math and maybe algebra.
customer_reviews.text: Good basic calculator but it can’t handle basic statistics equations and it can’t even get the square root of 37. This is why I’m giving it three stars as this is what I bought it for. It stated it could do basic stats but if it can’t get the square root of 37 how is going to do the equation (1.3(3.45x.45/squareroot of 37)) (had to write our square root because keyboard didn’t have symbol).
customer_reviews.author: WillC1123

customer_reviews.title: Great for high school level and testing
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter's Algebra 2 class (can't have a graphing calculator) and for use later in the SATs. It works great. I'm not so sure about the instructions, but TIs are so popular that there are a million resources on the internet and most teachers can help if you have issues. My daughter had moved from a lower level TI so she had no issues figuring it out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two months of usage
customer_reviews.text: I received this calculator on November 2nd, 2017. A little over two months later, I have discovered that none of the keys are functional. This is extremely inconvenient for me not only because I have a pro-calculator geometry test tomorrow, in which I will have to use a calculator that I am unfamiliar with, but because I have my geometry midterm exam next week, for which I will have to purchase a new calculator. Let's hope it works for more than two months this time.
customer_reviews.author: rosemary stitt

customer_reviews.title: Study the manual before using
customer_reviews.text: This calculator can do a lot of functions, it just isn't as intuitive as some others. I recently had a calculator that could perform all of the functions needed for College Algebra and Algebra II, and although it may not have been able to do some of the more obscure functions that this one can, it was much more intuitive and the button layout was a little easier to use. Overall, this calculator isn't bad, but I would say that there are better ones out there for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne R. Forster

customer_reviews.title: Only one approved by school.
customer_reviews.text: The only model approved by my son's AP Algebra teacher. Seems to do everything he needs it to do. He used it for his homework last night. Of course, it came up with the same answers as the TI-30X IIS I had already gotten for him...so... Not sure what the big deal is. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Ryno D. Bones

customer_reviews.title: I got my GED!
customer_reviews.text: While in a GED class my math teacher notified us that this was approved to use while taking the GED. I purchased mine that day. It arrived the next day. During the GED class my teacher efficiently taught us how to use it. I had never used this calculator before. I used while taking the math portion of the GED and I passed! It was the last subject I needed to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Nolia

customer_reviews.title: This is the most amazing calculator I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing calculator I have ever used!! It does everything and more. Use parentheses, fractions, square roots, exponents, scientific notation, decimals, and so much more. My old TI-10 was expensive in the 1980's - this is a reasonable price for a sturdy, easy to read calculator that can work quadratic equations. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: preacherlady

customer_reviews.title: The MultiView feature is gamechanging
customer_reviews.text: This calculator gives you the ability to set up calculations that you could usually only do on a programmable graphing calculator. This saved me a bunch of time while taking my actuary exams. While it technically isn't programmable, the memory and table features are also quite handy if you need to test multiple variables for a quadratic equation solution.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew harnden

customer_reviews.title: exactly as pictured / great for the price
customer_reviews.text: just as pictured. perfect for algebra. i really like the buttons, very easy to press. some calculator buttons i think may be shorter or something and you really have to push them down hard to make sure the info was inputted correctly and that was annoying to deal with. the dark teal color is nice, too. makes algebra a little less crappy having a cute blue calc!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Very limited
customer_reviews.text: Has a relatively low character limit when doing calculations. It can simplify radicals but it isn't very good at it. It can simplify easy radicals but when it comes to larger numbers, it spits out a decimal answer. The buttons also aren't the most reactive (it's hard for the calculator to realize you're pushing the buttons). Love the x10^n feature! but again it eats up your character limit quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend-
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for her middle school math class. I picked it based just on the color and look, but my daughter absolutely loves it. She says it is one of the better ones as compared to her schoolmates. It can do lots of cool things I don't understand, but she does. I would recommend this based on her reaction after using it just a few weeks. SHe's only in the 8th grade, but this will do her in to High School too.
customer_reviews.author: SMor

customer_reviews.title: Can Always Find it on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son, who is in high school, because that was what his teacher wanted them to have. He said that the regular TI-30X would not do; it HAD to be the multi-view, and my son said that this is fitting his needs just fine. I had no luck finding one at Office Depot, but found a wide choice on Amazon (of course), so I (as usual) went with the best price combined with the best reviews. I can definitely see why, and I am giving a good review myself.
customer_reviews.author: wacamato

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I got this scientific calculator for my brother in high school and he likes it despite the picky person he is. He did say the cover was a little annoying to take off and put on, but he's satisfied with everything else. Many of my friends also have it and they were the ones who recommended it to me. I love the color scheme of the blue and white one. The way the calculator displays the calculation is also really nice and I'm thinking about getting myself one for my next semester in college.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: By far the best scientific calculator I have ever personally used
customer_reviews.text: By far the best scientific calculator I have ever personally used. The multiple line display puts it so far ahead of other scientific calculators. The user interface is great. It also has every feature you should expect a scientific calculator to have and then some. Yes, there are scientific calculators out there that have more features (derivatives, integrals, etc.), but to me those are watered down graphing calculators with functions that most people would not expect a scientific calculator to include. Unless you specifically need a scientific calculator with those functions, for say a standardized test, then this calculator will exceed all expectations. Definitely the best option of the approved actuary exam calculators, for anyone wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: This calculator is approved for use with the Fundamentals of ...
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is approved for use with the Fundamentals of Engineering and Principles and Practice of Engineering. I had a TI-84 in college but the more advanced calculators are not allowed in the exams. This calculator, while not as advanced does nearly anything a civil engineer would need of it. The TI-84 now just sits collecting dust and I have two TI-30XS one at my desk at work and one at my home office.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Chem
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, only bought this because my Chemistry professor won't allow us to use graphing calculators on exams. Overall, its easy to use, but I just don't care for it. It is slim and does have a lot of functions to it, but for anything above Introductory Algebra, I would recommend a graphing calculator. I do like that it is solar powered, which means not having to change batteries or keep up with little chargers. Overall, decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: It's what the kids and college students need for school
customer_reviews.text: My eldest is starting college classes and his first math class, he still needs this. My second one is now taking a class and the teacher requires the same thing. First one has held up well for years, no hesitation grabbing a second one. Kids have never had any problems with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is def my favorite calculator of all time. The "MultiView" means you can easily see your past calculations and answers. Memory function and last answer functions also work great. I now own 4 of these calculators so I always have one within arms reach. While they are solar calculators, they do have a battery in them. When this battery dies, there starts to be some performance issues. In my case every once in a while it would shut off after a calculation and the only way it would wake up would be to reset the entire calculator. However, it should last at least 4 years of use, and the battery is easy enough to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for 6th grade math
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use calculator. There are so many on the market that all look about the same it is very hard to decide. I picked this for my son in Advanced 6th grade math. Turns out this is the calculator his math teacher uses in the classroom. so I guessed correctly. So many features but he seems to be getting the hang of it so far. It does fractions and I think this will last for his math journey for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: GED  Test Takers Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I got this calculator for when I was going to take my GED test last year. It was something I knew I was going to need and if I didn't have it I would have failed. Math is such a hard subject for myself in some sections. This calculator made it easy to understand how to use it. It has instructions on the back of the lid which my GED testing place took away as it was a "cheat sheet" So, learn how to use it by the lid! It will be a lifesaver! This helped me with fractions and square root. If you struggle with even those this will save you.
customer_reviews.author: AlyssaMT

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a year ago and used it for one physics class. Now I'm taking another physics class and I pull this out and it doesn't work! The keys are hard and when you press them, they don't display the values! Waste of 16$. Sincerely, A broke college student
customer_reviews.author: Orange

customer_reviews.title: Nice Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Just what my daughter needs for algebra class she keep saying she couldn’t do her homework because she didn’t know how to work the old scientific calculator. Therefore, it was a must so she could do her homework Arrived in Excellent condition with speedy shipping 📦 Highly satisfied customer
customer_reviews.author: Cleotonia

customer_reviews.title: Can See Fractions, Roots, Exponents... Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite scientific calculator I have ever used. Combination of solar and battery-powered is incredibly useful--I don't have to worry about the battery dying and/or not having a good light source when I have both. The biggest convenience about this calculator is the ability to see fractions, exponents, roots, etc as you would actually write them on paper. Helps prevent a lot of confusion when working with complicated problems! This is the way to go if your classes don't allow the use of graphing calculators. With the aforementioned and the price, I don't feel that it can be beat!
customer_reviews.author: SRHC

customer_reviews.title: It works good!
customer_reviews.text: Like the functionality, it's well laid out and easy to operate. Dislike the plasticky feel, but it seems durable enough, especially with the included snap on cover. Love the memory and that its solar powered. Dont love the color choices, but who said math was supposed to be fashionable? Not me... and not this calculator. Just my opinions.
customer_reviews.author: birdbrain

customer_reviews.title: Teacher recommended
customer_reviews.text: "Algebra is hard," says my daughter. Her teacher recommended this calculator. In order to do all the advanced options that calculators can do, it would be most helpful to press the exact same buttons that the teacher is pressing. Of course, being a teenager, she put it in her lunch bag and it got wet. After opening it up and drying it out overnight, it worked again! It's teen proof!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Mango Cafe

customer_reviews.title: I failed my Test because of an error
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is not accurate, how? I do now know, but it doesnt give the proper square root.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Hassan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best non-graphing calculator on the market. Every high school and college age student that I know of is familiar with this model, and so I don't have to explain it, they know it already. It pretty much does everything you could ask for. My only suggestion is to put your name on your calculator. As these are so common, it is easy for someone to think that they are picking up their calculator, when in actually it is yours.
customer_reviews.author: Scott in MO

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator approved for actuarial exams
customer_reviews.text: Excellent calculator. Approved for use with all actuarial exams. Convenient features including seven variables for storing values at intermediate calculation steps, data feature for statistics, solar power (no need to worry about batteries), and four lines of entries to view. The only things I could ask for in addition would be more variables (an alpha feature similar to how graphing calculators are arranged), a proper EE key, and buttons with a more definitive and precise operation... sometimes the buttons don't register or they may catch under the plastic faceplate while entering data. This happens infrequently but often enough where you have to be careful and verify your entries.
customer_reviews.author: Natty Mofo

customer_reviews.title: Calculator for SOA Exam
customer_reviews.text: I used this calculator to write my Society of Actuary (SOA) exam-P, IFM and STAM. This is one of the SOA recommended calculator. I used a lot it function in the pragmatic test center. I recommend to buying at least 5-6 month before the exam date and use manual for practice. Otherwise, You will write your exam without knowing its function which kills your important time in the exam center. Also, better idea to share experience with your friend regarding how to use calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Kids love. Said it was the same one they used at school
customer_reviews.author: Sand Norris

customer_reviews.title: Add..substract..divide...and banks multiply it
customer_reviews.text: I am not good at math so I bought this. Has a lot of buttons but I know only the add +, button. I thought the phone does have a calculator..? It was for my daughter for school. Works great. Recommended. So does Texas instruments.
customer_reviews.author: Zenel Alushi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent calculator for middle school student
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this calculator as a gift for a middle school student who excels in math. I have had good experiences with all of the Texas Instrument calculators that I have used in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and looks like it will last
customer_reviews.text: Got this form my daughter in Late Feb. IT serves its purpose well. Nice build quality. She has it in her school backpack and while it is not abuse it is not handled like eggshells either and there is no sign of this not being able to take the day to day use of not being in a desk drawer. You already probable know the functions that this can do if you are looking at it so I will not go into that. This looks like it will last and at a much better price than I found it locally.
customer_reviews.author: bugeater

customer_reviews.title: Can not return item
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that I can’t return this item. Great product but I accidentally ordered it after I had already bought my kid one for school. I didn’t need a second one....make sure you know what you are ordering because they won’t let you return it👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Rippin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best calculators i have ever had but was very disappointed when my math teacher noticed that something was wrong... whenever you would press the = button it would add a 5 to the equation, which can not guarantee an accurate answer. Very upset considering i payed for a working calculator and this is what i got.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Use this product if you want to be in Advanced Math
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 11 year old son for school. He was upset because he didn't get into advanced math, but by the end of September he was switched to advanced math! (I attribute this to the calculator, and NOT my son's hard work)
customer_reviews.author: Amy Ryczak

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy they wouldn’t take back unopened product
customer_reviews.text: I’m very unhappy I purchased at the same time my husband did not knowing that he also ordered, I tried to send it back the same day it came in. I never opened it and didn’t even open the box it came in. Needless to say I now am the owner of 2 calculators and have to figure out how to sell the spare. Not happy about not being able to return.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Good product; BEWARE: No returns
customer_reviews.text: Product is good, but seller accepts no returns for any reason even if product was damaged. I accidentally ordered 2 of these when I only needed one and I was stuck with two.
customer_reviews.author: E Family E

customer_reviews.title: Great sidekick to the BA II Plus for actuarial exams. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I actually use the financial calculator BA II Plus Professional which is approved for actuarial exams, but this calculator is a cheap sidekick that does some things that the BA II Plus can't do. The BA II can do all of your special financial calculations, however it lacks the Multiview display which allows you to quickly enter a line of of calculations. It also simplifies fractions for you (not that you'd really need that, but it's good that the feature is available.) If you are taking the actuarial exams, the BA II Plus and the TI-30X are the perfect combination. The TI-30X is only like $10 anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Jalal

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product but maybe I was used to Casio, where you can edit your exercise when you made a made a mistake, regardless if you prest enter or not, that’s the only thing that bothers me maybe I’m a picky user. But besides that it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaly Ajila Arevalo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Precalculus
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this incredibly easy to use, but it's perfect for my precalculus class. Math print is not available on some calculators like my Ti-83, so buying this calculator was definitely worth it. What a buy!
customer_reviews.author: Peter L.

customer_reviews.title: It works really well!
customer_reviews.text: The picture showed a teal color but I got a grey color but that doesn't change the fact that it is a perfectly good calculator! It is super easy to use in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne B.

customer_reviews.title: Best scientific  calculator for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my sons favorite calculator ever. It has many helpful capabilities and it is helpful to see more than one row of the math problem. It’s a little longer than its competitors but the length doesn’t bother him.
customer_reviews.author: Marybeth

customer_reviews.title: Math 1301! Excellent calculator!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my contemporary math 1301! Made my life easier. I love how you can see all the numbers! Buttons are big enough and easy to ready. Had all the functions I needed! So glad I bought this! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five stars (don't look over this product)
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced, I love this calculator because I write my problems and fractions a particular way that allowing me to plug from off paper or computer. can use this thing forever I bought a graphing calculator for College statistics a year ago. After that class I haven't touched it. But use this one is right beside my bed. You can virtually use it forever (p.a. I used it all through high school too).
customer_reviews.author: 300hemi

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged and paid extra since it is needed for a test.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon20000002

customer_reviews.title: The best quality calculator on the market
customer_reviews.text: A must have for middle and high school math. Excellent quality calculator That will probably last your child all the way through college. Spend a little more and get something the best quality like this product.
customer_reviews.author: BeckyW

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Return
customer_reviews.text: Nothing in description advises you that item can’t be returned. The item is unopened but they still won’t take it back. Very disappointed in this stance.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sauers

customer_reviews.title: Quality is less than desirable
customer_reviews.text: I have had TI calculators before but the quality of this particular calculator seems poor and felt cheaply made. Scope for improvement but the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat this price! Woohoo!
customer_reviews.text: When I had to buy a calculator like this for college it was 99.99 at Target. That was 18 years ago, so I was really happy with the $14 price of this one when I had to buy my own son one. TX is the way to go. They always provide quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Eckols

customer_reviews.title: Gift for school
customer_reviews.text: My grandson needed this for school so hence he received as a gift from me. I don't know much about it but he said its perfect and just what he needed. With TI you can't really go wrong they are an expert in calculators.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Van Gorder

customer_reviews.title: Calculated purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on calculators, but this one was recommended by co-workers who happen to be math teachers, so I bought it. Much better display than the TI-30XIIS I was using and displays answers in a more logical fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Okie Six

customer_reviews.title: Not great for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one of these I've had to buy in the last 5 months. If you're buying it for your child, and you have a rambunctious boy, get a hard case! The screen on these breaks very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Best Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this calculator since Algebra 1. I've used this calculator for grades: 8,9,10,11,12 and for college: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior and half of senior year. I just lost mine last week so I had to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ovadia Somekh

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for a college algebra course. It's approved by professors for proctored exams which is exactly what I needed! It's easy to use and reads very clearly. There's a mini laminated helpful guide that stays in the lid that comes with it. The lid is fully detachable and slides on and off. Definitely would recommend this over other brands because of how simple it is to use for even the toughest equations.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite calculator ever, which kind of makes me crazy, I guess, to be so excited about a calculator. But, I really am in love with this calculator. My favorite part of it, and the reason I bought it, is that it handles fractions. Add, subtract, convert to decimal, etc. Perfect for my math needs right now, and so far, puts up with the abuse that it endures being carried around in my backpack all the time.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: I would say this is a calculator to get for High School
customer_reviews.text: This calculator was required for my daughter’s ninth grade math class. She is very happy with it and is able to do all tasks required for algebra
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my college calculus and science classes. It works great and is easy to use. I went from using a more expensive graphing calculator to this one and I had no problem getting used to this one. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Westray

customer_reviews.title: It's a good calculator.
customer_reviews.text: I took the advice from an Amazon reviewer to get this one. It displays more history than the other standard calculator. I used it in an exam with great results. The color choice is odd but I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Otto Andersson

customer_reviews.title: I like this shape and type ,easy to use !
customer_reviews.text: It’s very easy to use and learn ,I bought this calculator because I want prepare for placement test ,the shape and design are very nice and easy to handle it ,love it !
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Great work calculator
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator I've had in a long time - I like to have a stand-alone calculator at work because it helps me to keep my focus on the task at hand. This has all the features I need, but the best part for me is that I can go back and see my previous calculation history and easily select previous results for use in a new calculation as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return this item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this by mistake (daughter needed a different one for school) and Amazon will not let me return it. That's disappointing!! I'm sure the calculator works fine, but do not purchase unless you know you won't need to return it. I can't even find in the description where it says you can't return this item. Not happy!! Edit: I contacted Amazon about this concern - they refunded me for the item and said to keep the item. They suggested donation since I can't use it. I will be donating to the school for a child to use who can't afford. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: My kid was complaining about my old HP 48G
customer_reviews.text: I have an ancient(?) HP 48 from when I was in school, and my kid needed a calculator to do his homework. I got tired of him complaining, so I asked the model of the calculator he uses at school and this was it. So I matched it and he shut up after that.
customer_reviews.author: General Anders

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite calculator. It can do most things a graphing calculator can (except, obviously, graph) at a fraction of the cost and in a less complicated manner. I promise, it isn’t just about the money for me. I never liked using the graphing calculators I was sometimes loaned in school. Too complicated. This one got me through high school, the SATs, and currently through college (where most math classes don't allow you calculators anyway). Unless you have a very urgent need for graphing utilities, this calculator is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Carolin

customer_reviews.title: Great scientific calculator but lacks good instructions
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of features. It's a great advanced scientific calculator that I used for my college math class. I like that it keeps the steps to the current math problem on the screen display. However the instructions aren't thorough enough to explain how to use more than the basic options.
customer_reviews.author: Clint croft

customer_reviews.title: Kids highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought for kids it is the one the teacher uses at school so she showed them how to use it. I actually ended up ordering several for their friends. They have lasted very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Advanced Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Used this for Amateur Radio exams. Does great with fractions and trigonometry. Very light weight with a nice cover. Good memory function that acts like the old adding machines. Use the arrow keys!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is ok but it didn’t function in some of the ways my TI did. I would probably not purchase this again. It is made well and the size is easy to handle. I would say it’s more for basic math.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good starter scientific calculator for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome starter scientific calculator for middle school kids. Bought 2 for my 7th grade daughters. Easy to use and has all the bells and whistles needed for algebra, geometry and trigonometry.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pyhtila

customer_reviews.title: Battery listed in Product Information is WRONG!
customer_reviews.text: Calculator is fine. But, 1. Product Information states "Batteries 1 CR123A batteries required. (included)" - so I bought extra CR123As WRONG!! It actually uses a "CR2032" coin battery. 2. Item was $2.50 cheaper the day AFTER I bought it. Go figure Sucks to be me!
customer_reviews.author: Cagayan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is very meticulous, and the calculator looks good and delicate. Easy to use. There are four lines. Support solar and battery charging. Comes with instructions. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Leona

customer_reviews.title: Sender shouldn’t be trusted
customer_reviews.text: It’s disgusting how I received a calculator thinking it’s new and tried to return this crap and sender doesn’t allow returns. I believe that a little bit of more honesty can preserve anger in a customer... the pics used on this site is not the same as how originally it looks. It’s not even working properly. This is trash... 😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡🤬🤬🤬 I wouldn’t dare to do something like this to anyone I hope others do t fall for it like me...
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes Ortiz Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: So important!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product I failed the ged math 5 times and then I finally had to get this because it was so useful I studied for another week and went to take a test with this calculator then passed. Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: elvis hrustic

customer_reviews.title: Take the time to read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: This calculator was very helpful while taking my NACE CIP Level 1 Course. Easy to use after reading the instructions and understanding the functions that you need it for.
customer_reviews.author: David Allday

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I had to order this calculator since this is the only recommended and approved by my kid's school. The quality is great and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: HolyCow

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted a calculator that was a little different from everyone else’s so she knew it was hers. But it works just like the rest of the classes :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H

customer_reviews.title: Can’t do many stuff
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling doing some equations, I tought I couldn’t find the right functions. But I learned that there are no functions that I was looking for. It is bad...
customer_reviews.author: Enes

customer_reviews.title: This is *thee calculator to get for exam P
customer_reviews.text: Make sure and use the table function which makes it super easy to calculate variances in a crunch. ALso super nice that it's multi view and you can set up formulas.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Watson

customer_reviews.title: Good calculator for my General Chemistry Class. The only annoying thing is the <> "equivalency" button.
customer_reviews.text: Good calculator for my General Chemistry Class. The only annoying thing is the <> "equivalency" button is where the = sign should be. I hit this button so many times during my exam, it is annoying. However, everything works as expected and new in box. Carries out the all the functions as advertised. Genuine new in box product..
customer_reviews.author: Waterfall3500

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing for the price and has everything I need. I can bring this to tests because it’s not a graphing calculator but still has helpful tools
customer_reviews.author: Brynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this calculator upon recommendation of my grandson' s 7th grade teacher. Works great and easy to use. Purchased the case to protect and go with it. Great price on both. Very happy with both items.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Like them
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, great price. Bout 3 of these for my kids, they seem to be what they need, only time will tell
customer_reviews.author: stacey

product_meta.title: Texas Instruments TI-30XS MultiView Scientific Calculator
product_meta.description:
Color:Blue and WhiteDesigned with unique features to allow you to enter more than one calculation, compare results and explore patterns, all on the same screen. Enter and view calculations in common math notation via the MathPrint mode, including stacked fractions, exponents, exact square roots and more. Quickly view fractions and decimals in alternate forms by using the toggle key. Scroll through previous entries and investigate critical patterns as well as viewing and pasting into a new calculation. Explore an x, Y table of values for a given function, automatically or by entering specific x values. Toggle key lets you change the form of answers between exact and decimal approximation.

AMAZON.COM
Powerful, four-line scientific calculator for high school math and science exploration. Designed with unique features to allow you to enter more than one calculation compare results and explore patterns all on the same screen. Enter and view calculations in common Math Notation via the MATHPRINT Mode including stacked fractions exponents exact square roots and more. Quickly view fractions and decimals in alternate forms by using the Toggle Key. Scroll through previous entries and investigate critical patterns as well as viewing and pasting into a new calculation. Explore an x y table of values for a given function automatically or by entering specific x values. Power Source(s): Battery Solar Display Notation: Numeric Number of Display Digits: N/A Display Characters x Display Lines: 16 x 4.Unit of Measure : Each 

Key Features: 

Four-line display One- and two-variable statistics MathPrint™ feature Fraction/decimal conversion Step-by-step fraction simplification Edit, cut and paste entries Solar and battery powered 
Ideal For: General math Pre-Algebra Algebra 1 and 2 Geometry Statistics General science Biology Chemistry
feature_bullets: Designed with unique features to allow you to enter more than one Calculation, compare results and explore patterns, all on the same screen.
Enter and view calculations in common math notation via the math Print mode, including stacked fractions, exponents, exact square roots and more.
Quickly view fractions and decimals in alternate forms by using the toggle key.

Scroll through previous entries and investigate critical patterns as well as viewing and pasting into a New Calculation. The TI-30XS MultiView scientific calculator is approved for use on SAT, ACT, and AP exams
Explore an x, y table of values for a given function, automatically or by entering specific x values.Up to 23 levels of parentheses

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
